intro: Tristemma leiocalyx var. pierlotii, commonly known as the white-flowered tristemma, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly rough texture. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
